reviews.review: this game is shit, have too many bugs, toxic players, a retarded community but this game is addicting and i played this bullshit like 15000 hours on my old steam account if you dont want to have iq of a plants vs zombies peashooters iq then dont play this shit but if you want have fun this game is fine for you i guess?

ToLongDidn'tRead is at the bottom, as I do ramble.

The game has a very rough learning experience if you are coming from outside, however if you can get past the mild toxic player base it is a very fun and rewarding game to play. And by toxic, I mean I stop playing dota2, to go relax with the player community here. Most people find hostile, but it just makes me laugh. Toxic is dota.

It faces the normal issues with asymmetric multiplayer games, the side with more players shouldn't have the ability to have voice communication and perfect knowledge as that is the point of playing the side of survivor. You are alone, with 3 other people. You don't know them, you don't know what they know, you do not know that where the player talking in your ear is making noice notifications is where the killer's special ability totem is. And that they are going to lure the killer away, while you run full speed to destroy that totem. (See? That shouldn't be a thing)

But regardless of the issues, I play the side of the killer. I get flamed, my profile is a collection of survivors posting their emotional weakness in the form of salt, every play style is legit as the killer if it means your rank is going up. If it isn't then you need to change your tactics, or whatever.

Anyways... TLDR: If you like hard games, and get off on knowing you're better then other human players, get the game. Learn how to play killer. And buy Nurse, you need that killer for top tier gameplay usually.

Firstly, I would just like to say that I am not an amazing DBD player, my rank usually stays between 5 and 7 so there are much more experienced people who can give a more comprehensive and accurate review of this game than I can. However, as someone who has played over 600 hours of this game of both killer and survivor I think I know at least a little. Starting off, the developer team is very out of touch with how it's game is played and it's playerbase and is shown whenever they only listen to one side or the other when considering balance changes. If you want to play killer, get ready for an uphill battle as you will be verbally berated at the end of maybe half of your matches by survivors for simple things like; going back to check on a hooked survivor who hasn't been saved for awhile, playing a killer that you enjoy to play but survivors find annoying or overpowered, using perks that they deem annoying, not farming for points with survivors when they want to, or even making a few simple mistakes during a match even when you're new to the game. If you want to play survivor, it's very simple and easy to get away with a pip (rank progression) most matches because the game is much more rigged in your favor. You have 3 other teammates that the killer can chase to give you time to complete objectives other than being chased for pipping. However Killers can feel pressured to continuously chase survivors off of generators and never be able to commit to a fun or exciting chase, or pressured to ignore the generators and just go for one good chase since how hopeless it feels to keep people off of generators. My review is definitely killer biased, but that is because while it is becoming easier and more "fun" as survivor, killer matches only feel stressful and frustrating. I do still love the idea of playing killer, but it is definitely not the power role anymore as you feel like you are the one being dragged through hoops most of the match. I do not recommend this game because the whole thing just feels like a joke and has become too tiring for me to care enough anymore to stick with it.

Jogo bacana para passar o tempo com os amigos, hoje com a funcionalidade de crossplay e o constante lançamento de cosméticos para o jogo, quem joga fica preso e se mantém fiel ao game. No entanto, Dead By Daylight é cheio de bugs, a cada chapter novo ou correções que sobem, o jogo fica mais bugado ainda e às vezes inviabiliza a jogatina, fazendo a gente desistir por um tempo.
